preface.p: An Act to establish the {{ZONE_NAME}} Special Economic Zone and provide for its governance, regulatory framework, and digital administration.

content.p: This Act may be cited as the {{ZONE_NAME}} Enabling Act.
This Act commences on {{EFFECTIVE_DATE}} or such later date as the Minister may appoint by notice.
In this Act, unless the context otherwise requires—

item.p: Authority means the {{AUTHORITY_NAME}} established under section 4.
Zone means the geographic and/or digital boundary designated under section 3.
Entity means a body corporate or other legal person registered under the Zone registry.

content.p: The Minister may, by notice, designate an area as a Special Economic Zone and define its boundary, including any digital perimeter for online services.
There is established an Authority to administer the Zone, including rulemaking powers as provided in this Act.
The Authority MAY issue bylaws and the Minister MAY issue regulations for the administration of this Act.
Regulations and bylaws MUST be published in the official gazette and in machine-readable form.
The Zone MAY maintain electronic registries and recognize digital signatures consistent with applicable law.
Where an attestation is produced by an approved system, it MAY be admissible as evidence subject to regulations.
A person aggrieved by an administrative decision of the Authority MAY appeal in accordance with regulations.
Schedules form part of this Act.

attachment.heading: Schedule 1 — Matters that may be regulated

doc.p: This schedule lists illustrative matters: entity registry procedures, licensing conditions, reporting obligations, and corridor eligibility.
